introduction: The following text is adapted from The Call of the Wild by Jack London (1903). Buck, the protagonist, reflects on his new life in the wild.
text: Buck had always been domesticated, but the wilderness was a different world. <u>At first, the harsh conditions were terrifying, but gradually Buck’s instincts took over. He felt the pull of the wild as though it had been calling him all along, and with each passing day, he became stronger, more attuned to the rhythms of nature. He was no longer just a pet—he was part of the wild.</u>
question: Which choice best describes the function of the underlined portion in the text as a whole?
A: It shows that Buck is struggling to adapt to the wild and is fearful of the challenges it presents.
B: It emphasizes how Buck’s transformation into a wild animal is driven by his instincts and connection to nature.
C: It illustrates Buck’s growing resentment toward his past life as a domesticated pet.
D: It reflects Buck’s realization that he no longer needs the company of humans to survive.
explanation: Choice A is the best answer because the underlined portion highlights how Buck’s instincts guide his transformation and how he begins to feel at home in the wild, a natural part of the environment.Choice B is incorrect because while the passage acknowledges the difficulty of the wild, it focuses more on Buck’s adaptation and growth rather than fear.Choice C is incorrect. The passage doesn’t focus on resentment toward his past life but on Buck’s growing connection to his natural instincts.Choice D is incorrect because the passage does not suggest Buck’s realization of not needing humans; it focuses more on his transformation into a creature of the wild.Let me know if you need further adjustments or more examples!
